This should ensure  that the following stylesheet processing instruction is honored by  these new browser versions. For some more background you might want  to visit the following bug report:  https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=338621  --> <?xml-stylesheet type="text/xsl" href="/WebResource.axd?d=OG6ICBS3XdykvyL_wBngEtwfPZ1xqVL3SJbFznhjfEgbO7QCYjHbDfgdgnO_5IYl31FcIeZ2u_qHqs8zCgU_y6DDpKxLyAV4MxNJVxfxbqAA9wnJHfwytgbvEYfRnFp2CKySbJEfaqzaXNpSNK6oTGhGshY1&t=635319500310794128" media="screen"?> <feed xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" xmlns:content="http://purl.org/rss/1.0/modules/content/" xmlns:media="http://search.yahoo.com/mrss/">   <title>Mathematical Sciences</title>   <subtitle>Mathematics is the language of science, technology and finance. It underpins applications ranging from telecommunications to the origins of the universe; from the human genome to financial markets. A degree in mathematics equips you with high-level analytical skills that open the door to a wide range of careers.</subtitle>   <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/mathematicalsciences/mathematicalsciences.aspx?RelatedItemsasStandardList_SyndicationType=2" />   <generator>Contensis: http://www.contentmanagement.co.uk</generator>   <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/mathematicalsciences/mathematicalsciences.aspx?SyndicationType=2</id>   <updated>2015-03-06T08:16:44Z</updated>   <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/mathematicalsciences/mathematicalsciences.aspx?SyndicationType=2" rel="self" type="application/atom+xml" />   <entry>     <title>Mathematics (International Study) BSc</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/mathematicalsciences/mathematics-international-study.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Lorraine Hammond</name>     </author>     <summary>The BSc Mathematics (International Study) offers an opportunity to broaden your educational and personal experience beyond that obtainable from a traditional three-year BSc in Mathematics. The third year of the course is spent studying mathematics and related subjects at an overseas university.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T18:04:00Z</published>     <updated>2014-11-27T10:22:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/mathematicalsciences/mathematics-international-study.aspx</id>     <category term="Maths" />     <category term="STATS" />     <category term="Mathematics" />     <category term="mathematical" />     <category term="sciences" />     <category term="statistics" />   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Mathematics MMath</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/mathematicalsciences/mmath-mathematics.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Lorraine Hammond</name>     </author>     <summary>The three-year BSc and four-year MMath courses have a common programme for the first two years. The first year includes core modules that provide an essential foundation of mathematical skills, as well as more specialised modules in pure mathematics, applied mathematics and probability and statistics</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T18:05:00Z</published>     <updated>2014-12-11T12:43:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/mathematicalsciences/mmath-mathematics.aspx</id>     <category term="Actuaries" />     <category term="Maths" />     <category term="Mathematics" />     <category term="STATS" />     <category term="statistics" />     <category term="Probability" />   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Mathematics and Economics BSc</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/mathematicalsciences/bsc-mathematics-economics.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Lorraine Hammond</name>     </author>     <summary>This course is aimed at mathematically minded people, probably seeking to enter the business or financial sector upon graduating; for example as management consultants, actuaries, accountants or business analysts.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T18:06:00Z</published>     <updated>2014-12-11T12:26:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/mathematicalsciences/bsc-mathematics-economics.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Mathematics and Management BSc</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/mathematicalsciences/mathematics-management.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Rose Stapleton</name>     </author>     <summary>The ability to reason quantitatively and logically lies at the heart of many management decisions. This BSc course is designed to equip you with the skills needed to succeed in a wide range of business and management careers.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T18:07:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-03-05T09:40:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/mathematicalsciences/mathematics-management.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Mathematics BSc</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/mathematicalsciences/mathematics.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Lorraine Hammond</name>     </author>     <summary>The three-year BSc and four-year MMath courses have a common programme for the first two years. The first year includes core modules that provide an essential foundation of mathematical skills, as well as more specialised modules in pure mathematics, applied mathematics and probability and statistics.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T18:05:00Z</published>     <updated>2014-12-11T12:39:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/mathematicalsciences/mathematics.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Financial Mathematics BSc</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/mathematicalsciences/financial-mathematics.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Lorraine Hammond</name>     </author>     <summary>This course offers you a broad and challenging modern curriculum which enables you to deepen your understanding of mathematics and particularly its application to finance.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T18:04:00Z</published>     <updated>2014-12-11T12:22:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/mathematicalsciences/financial-mathematics.aspx</id>     <category term="finance" />     <category term="financial" />     <category term="Maths" />     <category term="Mathematics" />     <category term="STATS" />     <category term="statistics" />     <category term="Probability" />   </entry> </feed>
